alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Carver; Chisago; Dakota; Hennepin; Isanti; Ramsey; Scott; Sherburne; Washington; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued January 11 at 2:29PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...The Minnesota Pollution Control Agency has extended the Air Quality Alert for fine particle pollution. The Air Quality Index (AQI) is expected to reach the Orange or Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups category. * WHERE...Central Minnesota. * WHEN...Through midnight tonight. The air quality alert that was in effect for the remainder of central and northwestern Minnesota will expire at 6pm. * IMPACTS...Sensitive groups, such as people with lung disease (including asthma), heart disease, and children and older adults, may experience health effects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A cold front currently moving across Minnesota will disperse fine particle pollution across central Minnesota. Air quality observations have indicated that the dispersion process has been lagging by several hours following the cold front and the air quality alert has been extended until Midnight to account for these trends. For information on current air quality conditions in your area and to sign up for daily air quality forecasts and alert notifications by email, text message, phone, or the Minnesota Air mobile app, visit https://www.pca.state.mn.us/air/current-air- quality. You can find additional information about health and air quality at https://www.pca.state.mn.us/air/why-you-should-care- air-quality-and-health.
info.instruction: Sensitive groups, such as people with lung disease (including asthma), heart disease, and children and older adults, should limit prolonged or heavy exertion.

area.areaDesc: Anoka; Carver; Chisago; Dakota; Hennepin; Isanti; Ramsey; Scott; Sherburne; Washington; Wright
